trait.name: Flyby
entries: The nameless thing doesn't provoke an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Psychic Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) Psychic damage, and if the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of the nameless thing's next turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the ravencraft to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 5} plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a successful save, the ravencraft drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Harbinger of Doom (2/Day)
entries: The ravencraft lets out a wail of anguish commingling with the croaking of ravens. {@actSave wis} {@dc 11}, one creature within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

reaction.name: Death Veil
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 30 feet of the ravencraft makes a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the save.

monster.name: Salmon of Knowledge
languages: understands all but can't speak; telepathy 60 ft.

trait.name: Orb of Water
entries: The salmon is surrounded by a sphere of flowing water that moves with it. While inside of the sphere, the salmon has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage. A creature that grapples the salmon can choose to pull it out of the orb of water. The orb of water moves up to 20 feet toward the salmon at the start of each of the salmon's turns. If it enters the salmon's space, the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition ends on the salmon.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The salmon can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The salmon makes two Water Spray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Prophetic Guidance.

action.name: Water Spray
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 20/60 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Cold damage.

action.name: Prophetic Guidance (2/Day)
entries: A creature the salmon can see within 30 feet gains a flash of foresight. Once in the next minute, when the creature fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it can roll {@dice 1d4} and add it to the total, potentially turning the failure into a success.

reaction.name: Echo from the Current
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 5 feet makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check. {@actResponse} The creature can use the salmon's Wisdom modifier (+4) in place of its own ability modifier for the check.

action.name: Cursed Scratch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the start of the witchwoven's next turn.

reaction.name: Protective Bond
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature the witchwoven can see within 60 feet takes damage. {@actResponse} The creature gains {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the triggering damage, and the witchwoven takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Force damage.

spellcasting.name: Undying Mount {@recharge 5}
headerEntries: The king casts {@spell Phantom Steed|XPHB}, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The conjured steed takes no damage from areas of effect. The spell ends early if the king casts it again.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The king has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshall Undead
entries: Undead creatures of the king's choice (excluding himself) in a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from him have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and saving throws. He can't use this trait if he has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Name of Rest
entries: The king has AC 10 against attack rolls made with a weapon inscribed with the runic form of his original name, and the king has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls made against a creature holding such a weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king makes three Soul Blade attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Life Drain.

action.name: Soul Blade
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 14}, reach 5 ft. or range 40/80 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) Slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Necrotic damage. {@hom}The blade magically returns to the king's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 22}, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) Necrotic damage, and the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.
A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature Wight|XMM} under the king's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

action.name: Blade Storm {@recharge 5}
entries: The king's blade flies in a deadly arc around him. {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}, each creature of the king's choice in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from him. {@actSaveFail} A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Force damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} The king is hit by an attack roll while holding a weapon or shield. {@actResponse} The king adds 7 to his AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

legendary.name: Death Grasp
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 22}, one creature the king can see within 100 feet. {@actSaveFail} A ghostly, skeletal arm pulls the target up to 40 feet closer to the king, and the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Grim Charge
entries: The king moves up to his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} (or commands his mount to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}) and makes one Soul Blade attack.

legendary.name: Lord's Call
entries: The king magically summons two {@creature Wight|XMM|Wights} into unoccupied spaces he can see within 30 feet of himself.

The wights obey the king and take their turn immediately after him on the same {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. A wight vanishes after 1 hour, when it or the king dies, or when the king uses this action again. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a wight must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn. The king can't use this action again until the start of his next turn.

spellcasting.name: Project Image
headerEntries: The beast casts the {@spell Project Image|XPHB} spell, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. During the spell's duration, the beast can use its Spew Blight action and Rot Stride {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} as if it were in the image's space.

trait.name: Blighted Overgrowth
entries: While the beast is {@status Bloodied|XPHB}, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls, its Spew Blight action recharges at the start of its turn, and if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} at the start of its turn, it regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
If it takes Fire damage, it doesn't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Fungal Step
entries: The beast ignores {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} caused by plants or fungi.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the beast fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unraveled Longing
entries: If the beast can see the likeness of its long-lost love at the start of its turn, the beast takes 10 Psychic damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beast makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 17}) from one of two claws. If the beast moved at least 20 feet immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Poison damage.

action.name: Spew Blight {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it automatically succeeds. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Rot Stride
entries: The beast teleports to an unoccupied space within 60 feet. Either its starting or destination space must contain fungus or rotting organic matter.

legendary.name: Hallucinate
entries: The beast exhales hallucinatory spores. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}, one creature within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is affected by the {@spell Confusion|XPHB} spell until the start of the beast's next turn. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The beast can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Impale
entries: The beast impales a creature it is grappling on one of its exposed ribs (it can have two creatures impaled at a time). {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, one creature the beast is grappling. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Piercing damage, and the target now has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 17}) from an impaling rib, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The beast can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Trample
entries: The beast moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. A Large or smaller creature in a space the beast enters must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

spellcasting.name: Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: The Brimstone Behemoth casts {@spell Earthquake|XPHB} and {@spell Meteor Swarm|XPHB}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 24}).

trait.name: Burning Sacrifice
entries: If a creature willingly sacrifices its life in fire or lava for the purpose of defeating the behemoth, the creature can't be returned to life by any means. For the next 24 hours, the behemoth has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved, it has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Radiant damage, and it loses its Legendary {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} trait.

trait.name: Consuming Flame
entries: When the behemoth deals Fire damage, it can choose to deal Necrotic damage instead.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The behemoth has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The behemoth deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The behemoth can burrow through solid rock at half its {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} and leaves a 20-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behemoth makes one Bite attack, and it makes two Claw or Blazing Boulder attacks in any combination.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 18}, reach 15 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) Slashing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Fire damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}). Until the grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 18}, reach 15 ft. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) Slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Fire damage.

action.name: Blazing Boulder
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 18}, range 150 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d10 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Fire damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke
entries: The behemoth casts {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Cataclysmic Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Fire Rain
entries: The behemoth makes one Blazing Boulder attack.

legendary.name: Lava Well
entries: The behemoth causes lava to cover the ground in its space and in any unoccupied spaces in any tunnels it left by burrowing within 100 feet. A creature that touches the lava for the first time on a turn or starts its turn in the lava takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Fire damage. A creature takes this damage only once per round.
The lava cools and hardens after 1 hour or when the behemoth uses this action again. The behemoth can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Trample
entries: The behemoth moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Claw attack. On a hit, if the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

spellcasting.name: Etherealness
headerEntries: The reaper casts the {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The reaper is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Ancestral Shame
entries: If a creature that can speak Orc within 30 feet of the reaper takes an action to read aloud the names carved in the stone on the reaper's back, the reaper takes 20 Radiant damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The reaper can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The reaper can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the reaper fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reaper makes one Balefire Scythe attack and one Chain attack, and it uses either Chain Slam or Fling.

action.name: Balefire Scythe
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 15 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Necrotic damage, and the target begins burning. It takes Necrotic damage instead of Fire damage while burning in this way.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 20 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}) from one of four chains.

action.name: Chain Slam
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 17}, each creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the reaper. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the start of the reaper's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Fling
entries: The reaper throws a Large or smaller creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by it to a space it can see within 30 feet of itself that isn't in the air. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Balefire Scythe
entries: The reaper makes one Balefire Scythe attack. The reaper can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Drift
entries: The reaper moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

legendary.name: Lantern Flare
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}, each creature of the reaper's choice in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from it. {@actSaveFail} The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The abbot casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):
will: {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} (can appear as a Medium Humanoid, 24-hour duration)

trait.name: Honor Lost
entries: If a creature takes a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to present a memento or recite a reminder of the abbot's past and succeeds on a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check, the abbot has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} he makes before the start of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the abbot fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The abbot can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The abbot takes 20 Radiant damage if he starts his turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, he has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abbot makes two Sanguine Blade attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Blood Call.

action.name: Sanguine Blade
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) Slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Blood Call
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, one creature other than a Construct or Undead within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by the damage taken. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The abbot regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage taken. A Humanoid reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a {@creature Crimson Clergy|CrookedMoon24} under the abbot's control.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} The abbot is hit by an attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The abbot adds 3 to his AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

legendary.name: Bloody Strike
entries: The abbot moves up to half his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and makes one Sanguine Blade attack.

legendary.name: Castigate
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 15}, one creature within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition and repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

legendary.name: Overwhelm
entries: The abbot casts {@spell Command|XPHB}. He can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Death's Shroud
entries: The mother always has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. Blindsight, Truesight, and other effects that allow a creature to see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures don't reveal the mother. A creature that has been reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at least once in its life can see her normally.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The mother can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the mother fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mother has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Steadfast Matron
entries: Undead creatures of the mother's choice in a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from her (excluding herself) have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws. She can't use this trait if she has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Undeniable Guilt
entries: At the start of her turn, if the mother can see a possession once owned by her living children, or if she can see or hear the spirits of her children, she has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the start of her next turn, and she must move as far from the object or spirits as possible.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mother makes three Shears attacks.

action.name: Shears
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 5 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) Force damage. If the target is a creature and is hit with two or more Shears attacks in the same turn, it gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

action.name: Mournful Tolling (1/Day)
entries: The mother focuses her wail into her bell. {@actSave wis} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the mother (Constructs, Undead, and creatures that have ever been raised from the dead succeed automatically). {@actSaveFail} 77 ({@damage 14d10}) Psychic damage that ignores the target's {@spell Resistance|XPHB}, if any, and the target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of the mother's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Soul Doll
entries: The mother targets the corpse of a creature she killed within the last minute. The target's soul is drawn out and transforms into a ceramic doll of the creature. The doll is a Tiny object with AC 15, HP equal to half the creature's maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Thunder damage, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage.
The soul can dimly see and hear its surroundings, and creatures with telepathy can communicate with the soul.

If the doll is destroyed, the soul arises from the doll as a Shadow under the mother's control. The creature can't be returned to life unless its soul is freed from the doll by a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell, or by destroying the shadow it spawned.

legendary.name: Drift
entries: The mother moves up to her {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. When she enters a creature's space during this move, that creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Cold damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. A creature takes this damage only once per turn. The mother can't take this action again until the start of her next turn.

legendary.name: Endless Keening
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 22}, each creature without the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the mother (Constructs, Undead, and creatures that have ever been raised from the dead succeed automatically). {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Necrotic damage that ignores the target's {@spell Resistance|XPHB}, if any. Failure by 5 or More: The creature is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The mother can't take this action again until the start of her next turn.

legendary.name: Snip
entries: The mother makes one Shears attack.

vulnerable.special: Damage dealt by a creature holding the headman's original skull

trait.name: Binding Skull
entries: The headsman has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to any damage dealt by a creature holding the headsman's original skull, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls made against that creature.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If the headsman fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The headsman has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The headsman makes two Headsman's Axe attacks and one Hooves attack.

action.name: Headsman's Axe
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 5 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) Slashing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Fire damage. If the target is a creature with at least one head and the headsman rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or it is decapitated and dies if it can't survive without a head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has Legendary Actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Force damage from the hit.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 5 ft. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage. If the headsman moved at least 20 feet immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Necrotic damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Flaming Skull {@recharge 5}
entries: The headsman hurls its skull, after which it reappears in the headsman's hand. {@actSave dex} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 10-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 63 ({@damage 14d8}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The target starts {@hazard burning|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The headsman moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

legendary.name: Rancorous Gaze
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 18}, one creature the headsman can see within 90 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The headsman can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Relentless Execution
entries: The headsman makes one Headsman's Axe attack with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. If the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, treat a 19 on the {@dice d20} as a 20.
The headsman can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Crooked Switch (1/Day)
entries: When the locomotive is {@status Bloodied|XPHB}, it regains all expended uses of Legendary {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and enters a malevolent form for 12 hours. In this form, it is Chaotic Evil and can use its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the locomotive fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack (Crooked Switch Only)
entries: The locomotive makes two Rail Slam attacks.

action.name: Rail Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 10 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 10 feet straight away.

action.name: Spirit Exhaust {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Ghostly Rails
entries: The locomotive moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} in a straight line without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.
A Large or smaller creature whose space it passes through has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}) from the spectral rails.

legendary.name: Haunting Whistle
entries: The locomotive blows its wailing steam whistle. {@actSave wis} {@dc 13}, one creature within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The locomotive can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Requires Curse Bottle)
headerEntries: The sinner casts one of the following spells using his {@variantrule Curses|XPHB|Curse} Bottle (and no other Material components) and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Coffin Rider
entries: The sinner has a magic coffin that has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage. While standing on the coffin, the sinner rides it on a ghostly wave of swamp water with a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet and can move over liquids as if they were solid.

trait.name: Curse Bottle
entries: The sinner has a bottle that holds cursed magic. The bottle has AC 15, HP 25, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage except Force. If the bottle is destroyed, the sinner can magically create a new one when he finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the sinner fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Overweening Pride
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can insult the sinner's skill and renown as a pirate captain. The sinner must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 Psychic damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any target other than the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sinner makes two attacks, using Hex Grasp or Blunderbuss in any combination. He can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast {@spell Bane|XPHB}.

action.name: Hex Grasp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the start of the sinner's next turn, or until the sinner curses it in this way again. While cursed, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and on ability checks that rely on an ability of the sinner's choice.

action.name: Blunderbuss
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 30/90 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) Force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 10 feet straight away.

action.name: Curse Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The sinner unleashes one of the following curses from his blunderbuss:

items.name: Jack's Anguish
entries: A magenta wave fires out with a deep, wailing moan. {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.
The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
After 1 minute, it automatically succeeds. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Shadowy Friends
entries: A wave of shadow coughs forth and wraps around foes. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the end of the sinner's next turn. If a {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} target takes damage, the condition ends early.

legendary.name: Barbed Curse
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}, one creature cursed by the sinner or affected by his {@spell Bane|XPHB} spell within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 6 ({@damage 1d12}) Force damage.

legendary.name: Grinning Grasp
entries: The sinner teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet. He makes one Hex Grasp attack before or after teleporting and can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.

legendary.name: Jinxed Ground
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 17}, each creature within a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the sinner. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The sinner can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.

spellcasting.name: Averting Winds
headerEntries: The terror casts the {@spell Wind Wall|XPHB} spell (which can't appear in a creature's space), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Demonic Mimicry
entries: The terror can mimic voices and sounds it has heard. A listener can discern the mimicry for what it is with a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the terror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The terror has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unraveling Song
entries: As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, a creature can play or sing Jericho Sticks' favorite song, "Coal-Eyed Birds," to give the terror the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of the creature's next turn. The condition ends early if the creature damages the terror or forces it to make a saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The terror makes one Claw attack and one Scythe attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) Slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Psychic damage.

action.name: Dirge of Secrets {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 15}, each creature within a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the terror. {@actSaveFail} The creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Psychic damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls. At the end of each of its turns, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.
After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Crow's Swoop
entries: The terror moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

legendary.name: Devour Secrets
entries: The terror's beak gapes and devours secrets. {@actSave wis} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the terror (with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} if the target has given up one of its secrets to the terror). {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Psychic damage, and the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The terror can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Enduring Restoration
entries: If the Horned King dies, its body disappears in a cloud of ash. It becomes an intangible, {@condition Invisible|XPHB} spirit in its home forest, and it can't reform a new physical body for {@dice 10d10} years.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Horned King fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Horned King has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Horned King makes three Cursed Strike attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Terrorizing Breath.

action.name: Cursed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12} (against a cursed target, scores a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}), reach 10 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (Horned King's choice) plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the end of the Horned King's next turn. While cursed, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

action.name: Breath of Corruption {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 19}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Necrotic damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Psychic damage, and the target gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level that ends at the end of the target's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Terrorizing Breath
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 19}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

bonus.name: Sense Desire
entries: The Horned King casts {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, requiring no spell components and using Charisma for the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}).

legendary.name: Taste of Wickedness
entries: The Horned King's snakelike tongue whips out hungrily. {@actSave cha} {@dc 20}, one cursed creature the Horned King can see within 15 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Psychic damage, the Horned King regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage taken, and one curse of the Horned King's choice affecting the target ends.

legendary.name: Temptation
entries: The Horned King speaks to a creature it can see within 120 feet and offers it either {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} or to restore 20 of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If the creature accepts, it gains that benefit but is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed, the Horned King has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage the target deals. The Horned King can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Trample
entries: The Horned King moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Cursed Strike attack.The Horned King can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The leviathan can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Returned Curse
entries: If the leviathan curses a creature holding an idol of Snake Eye Jack blessed by one of his devoted followers, the creature is unaffected by the curse. The leviathan then takes 20 Radiant damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leviathan makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 15 ft. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) Piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Force damage. The target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}), and until the grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 20 ft. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the leviathan.

action.name: Accursed Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 120-foot-long, 10-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 78 ({@damage 12d12}) Necrotic damage, and the target is cursed. The cursed target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The target can end the curse early if it voluntarily fails a saving throw forced by one of its enemies. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Swallow
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, one Large or smaller creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the leviathan (it can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time). {@actSaveFail} The target is swallowed and no longer {@condition Grappled|XPHB}. A swallowed creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against attacks and other effects outside the leviathan, and takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) Force damage at the start of each of its turns.

If the leviathan takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the leviathan must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the leviathan and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the leviathan dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition Prone|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Jinxed Hide
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 60 feet of the leviathan hits it with an attack roll or targets it with a spell. {@actResponse} The triggering creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed until the end of its next turn. The cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Devour
entries: The leviathan uses Swallow.

legendary.name: Swamp Surge
entries: The leviathan causes a swell of muddy water and grasping roots. {@actSave str} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the leviathan. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The leviathan can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Tail Sweep
entries: The leviathan moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and makes one Tail attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lord casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):
will: {@spell Project Image|XPHB} (appears as a Small Humanoid jester)

trait.name: Bitter Medicine
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can dismiss or belittle the lord's attempts at humor. If the creature succeeds on a {@dc 16} Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check, the lord has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any target other than that creature until the start of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Infinite Jest
entries: The lord creates an illusion of a Small Humanoid jester in his space. While he doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the lord can move the image up to 60 feet during his turn (no action required). The lord can perceive and speak through this image as if he were in the image's space. The image is insubstantial, but it can manipulate objects as if it has a Strength of 10.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the lord fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The lord can take one {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on every turn of combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lord makes two attacks, using Ribbon or Joy Buzzer in any combination. If the lord has cast {@spell Project Image|XPHB}, he can make melee Joy Buzzer attacks from the image's space.

action.name: Ribbon
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 15 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}) from one of six ribbons. It has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Joy Buzzer
entries: The lord's Infinite Jest illusion moves to a target within range. Melee or Ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB}: {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) Lightning damage, and the target can't take {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions} until the end of the lord's next turn. {@hom}The jester vanishes and reappears in the lord's space.

action.name: Exploding Pie {@recharge 5}
entries: The lord throws a massive pie that explodes in corrosive custard. {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point the lord can see within 100 feet. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Acid damage, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of the lord's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Ribbon Step
entries: The lord vanishes in a burst of confetti and ribbons and teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet.

legendary.name: Frolic
entries: The lord moves up to half his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}, during which he can move through other creature's spaces without expending extra movement to do so. A creature whose space the lord enters takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Psychic damage. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

legendary.name: Joke's on You
entries: The lord uses Spellcasting to cast either {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance|XPHB|Irresistible Dance} or {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Ribbon Dance
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 18}, each creature the lord is grappling. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Bludgeoning damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The lord can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Tall Man casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the Tall Man fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Tall Man has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Memory's Dance
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature can perform some steps from a dance of the Tall Man's court and make a {@dc 20} Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) check. On a success, the Tall Man takes 20 Force damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the start of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tall Man makes two Claw attacks and uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} ({@damage 4d6} Psychic damage).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 15 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) Slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}) from one of two claws, and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

bonus.name: Elusive Disguise
entries: The Tall Man magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back to his true form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying changes to accommodate his new form. He can take on any features he chooses, but he is always unnaturally tall for whatever guise he takes. He returns to his true form if he dies.

reaction.name: Evasive Blink
entries: {@actTrigger} The Tall Man takes damage. {@actResponse} The Tall Man has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the triggering damage and teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Spellcasting
entries: The Tall Man uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The Tall Man makes one Claw attack, then can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Tall Man teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. When he teleports, he can force a creature he is grappling to succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or teleport with him, appearing in the closest unoccupied space to the Tall Man's destination.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The abomination casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the abomination fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The abomination has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The abomination has three heads: a centipede hag's, a pigeon hag's, and a weasel hag's. Whenever the abomination takes 50 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies (determined randomly). The abomination dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns, if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} and any of its heads are dead, the abomination regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and one of its dead heads returns to life.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes three attacks, using Cauldron Slam or Brew Spray in any combination.

action.name: Cauldron Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Acid damage.

action.name: Brew Spray
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 90 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) Acid damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to AC until the end of the abomination's next turn.

legendary.name: Corrosive Teleport
entries: The abomination teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the abomination at its destination space. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Acid damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Crushing Leap
entries: The abomination jumps to a space within 30 feet that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in the abomination's destination space. {@actSaveFail} 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only, and the target is pushed 5 feet straight away from the abomination. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The abomination can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Hag's Head
entries: The abomination uses one of the following options (if the necessary head is alive); it can't use that option again until the start of its next turn:

items.name: Contagious Miasma (Centipede Hag Head)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, one creature the abomination can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The target repeats the saving throw when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, ending the effect on itself on a success. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Overwhelming Doubt (Pigeon Hag Head)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 18}, one creature the abomination can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Waking Nightmare (Weasel Hag Head)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 18}, one creature the abomination can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target perceives its allies as enemies but isn't compelled to act in a specific way. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the widow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reopened Memories
entries: At the start of her turn, if the widow can see a memento of her husband or some other reminder that forces her to realize what she's lost, she has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and can only expend 2 uses of her Legendary Actions until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The widow makes two Injection attacks.

action.name: Injection
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}1 Piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Poison damage. If the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target suffers one of the following effects of the widow's choice (each option can only be used once per turn):

items.name: Hyperphobic Stimulant
entries: The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. At the start of its turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take the Dash action and move away from the widow by the safest and shortest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

items.name: Soporific Infusion
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, the target hit by Injection. {@actSaveFail} The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved. On its turn, it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, but not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. Failure by 5 or More: The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until a creature takes an action to shake it awake.

items.name: Thaumaturgic Inhibitor
entries: If the target casts a spell, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or the spell fails, but a spell slot used to cast the spell isn't expended.

legendary.name: Alacrity
entries: The widow or a creature she is riding moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. Dose. The widow makes one Injection attack. She can't take this action again until the start of her next turn.

legendary.name: Hypertrophic Injections
entries: The widow targets herself or an ally within 5 feet and grants the target one of the following effects of her choice; she can't take this action again until the start of her next turn:

items.name: Aggression
entries: The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Fortitude
entries: One of the following conditions of the widow's choice ends on the target: {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

items.name: Vigor
entries: The target regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

monster.name: The White Worm
languages: understands all but can't speak; telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: If a creature tries to read the worm's mind, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If the worm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Poisoned Knowledge
entries: If the worm uses Devour Mind on a creature that knows a special sequence of constellations and their path through the sky, at the start of the target's next turn, the worm takes 50 Psychic damage and Devour Mind ends.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes one Bite attack and uses Psychic Caress on one or two creatures.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Psychic Caress
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 19}, one creature the worm can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of the worm's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Devour Mind (1/Day)
entries: The worm vanishes and magically enters the mind of a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The worm can't target a creature under the effect of  the {@spell Mind Blank|XPHB} or {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB} spells. While in the target's mind, the worm can't take actions, and the target experiences the worm appearing in its memories as it devours each one. At the end of each of the target's turns, it takes 88 ({@damage 16d10}) Psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target is {@variantrule Stable|XPHB} but loses all its memories permanently. Only a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell can restore the lost memories.

Devour Mind ends if the target is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and the worm appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the target. Devour Mind can also be ended in the following ways:

items: As an action, the target mentally duels the worm  and makes a {@dc 20} ability check using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (its choice). On a success, the worm must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the check's total or Devour Mind ends.
Devour Mind ends if the target receives an effect  that ends possession, including the {@spell Dispel Evil and Good|XPHB} spell.
If the target takes damage, the worm takes Psychic damage equal to half that amount. It must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the Psychic damage taken, or Devour Mind ends.

legendary.name: Slither
entries: The worm moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

legendary.name: Spawn Parasites
entries: The worm disgorges a slimy spray of pale, parasitic worms. {@actSave con} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} The target is infested with parasitic worms and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. At the start of the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target's turn, it takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) Necrotic plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Psychic damage as the worms burrow toward its brain. A creature reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage dies and then rises 24 hours later as a {@creature Wormhost Surgeon|CrookedMoon24}. The infesting worms are killed by any effect that ends the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition on the target, or if 10 Poison damage or more is dealt to it. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The worm can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The worm makes one Bite attack. It can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Burning Aura
entries: At the end of the each of the Wicker Man's turns, each creature of its choice in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the Wicker Man takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Fire damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} start burning.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the Wicker Man fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Wicker Man has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The Wicker Man can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on every turn of combat.

trait.name: Soul Motes
entries: The Wicker Man has 3 Soul Motes. It gains 1 Soul Mote when a creature that isn't a Construct or Undead dies within 30 feet of it. The Wicker Man can expend Soul Motes to fuel Soul Mote {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB|Reactions}. When the Wicker Man finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, its Soul Mote total resets to 3.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Wicker Man makes two Blazing Slam attacks.

action.name: Blazing Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 15 ft.  {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Fire damage.

action.name: Cremating Flame {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} A creature reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this damage is reduced to ash, and its soul is absorbed into the Wicker Man. The creature can't be restored to life by any means until the wicker man is destroyed.

reaction.name: Crushing Blow (Soul Mote)
entries: {@actTrigger} The Wicker Man hits with an attack roll. {@actResponse} The Wicker Man expends 1 Soul Mote, and the hit becomes a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Repair (Soul Mote)
entries: {@actTrigger} The Wicker Man starts its turn. {@actResponse} The Wicker Man expends 1 Soul Mote and regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Burning Clutch
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, one creature within 15 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 16}) from one of two hands, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends. At the start of the Wicker Man's turn, the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The Wicker Man can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: The Wicker Man makes one Blazing Slam attack. The Wicker Man can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Stride
entries: The Wicker Man moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The titan has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Runic Sever
entries: If the titan starts its turn within 50 feet of a stone at least 10 feet high and 10 feet wide that is carved with the glyph representing its forgotten creator, the titan takes 50 Necrotic damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The titan makes two Massive Fist attacks. It can replace one or both attacks with a use of Thrown Boulder.

action.name: Massive Fist
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 20 ft. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}) from one of two fists, and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Thrown Boulder
entries: The titan hurls a boulder at a point it can see within 150 feet. {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, each creature in a 10-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Wild Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 19}, each of the titan's enemies in a 100-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the titan. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of the titan's next turn. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, the creature must use its action to make its most powerful melee or ranged attacks against the nearest creature it can see.

legendary.name: Arm Sweep
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, each creature in a 20-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The titan can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Crushing Hurl
entries: The titan hurls an object it is holding, a creature it is grappling, or a Large clod of earth to a space within 100 feet. {@actSave dex} {@dc 25}, each creature in the projectile's space, including a hurled creature. {@actSaveFail} 19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The titan can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Stomping Stride
entries: The titan moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. It can enter a Huge or smaller creature's space, and the creature is pushed to nearest unoccupied space.

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Ranger level (the grim has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Ranger level)

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The grim can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. The grim takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shared Fate
entries: Add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to any ability check or saving throw the grim makes.

action.name: Ominous Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6 + 3} plus your Wisdom modifier Necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

reaction.name: Baleful Howl
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature moves out of the grim's reach. {@actResponse d}{@actSave wis} Your spell save DC, the triggering creature. {@actSaveFail} The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of the turn.

monsterFluff.name: Phillip Druskenvald
entries: Phillip Druskenvald is the lord of Druskenvald. His dapper appearance and affable personality belie the immense power he holds. While he appears to be a tall, thin man with perfectly slicked back hair and a pencil-thin mustache as black as night, the truth is that he is a timeless lord of death with his origins lost deep within the Shroud itself. . . even to him.

Despite ruling in Druskenvald for many years, he was not always the realm's master. Formerly, it had belonged to the fey goddess Kehlenn, who utilized the reincarnation magics of  the domain to rebirth souls as flora and fauna in a natural world where life was brutal and short.

Phillip is another kind of deathless being who arrived from beyond the mist eons ago. He usurped  the realm of rebirth, claiming its reincarnating powers for his own. He then reshaped the land into  his own design, even renaming it after himself. In this new afterlife, Phillip provided souls the opportunity  to be reborn as sapient mortal beings to enjoy a second chance at a "normal" life.

After the slow passage of millennia, Phillip forgot about his battle with Kehlenn or that there was ever a world before the one he forged himself. He now oversees the domain with his Crescent Court, composed of the thirteen lords and ladies of Druskenvald (see chapter 1). However, he finds governance tedious and prefers to enjoy the good life he brought to the afterlife, with all the messy and sinful comforts and indulgences that come with it.

While he maintains a general grasp of the current affairs of the thirteen major provinces of Druskenvald, Phillip is mostly ignorant of the happenings in Wickermoor Hollow, heightened by the crooked power of Kehlenn that shrouds it from his view. Even worse, while in the valley, Phillip has none of the supernatural powers that make him the most formidable being in the land.

He does not know, and will only learn too late, that in Wickermoor Hollow, Kehlenn has seized his power and weaves it toward her own aims in the creation of a newborn god of sin: the Horned King. While within the confines of the valley, Phillip is very nearly just a mortal man, which will lead to his inevitable destruction.

Phillip's newfound impotence frustrates him, but he still decides to remain in the valley after being stranded there with the characters. His curiosity is stronger than his sense of preservation, and he cannot fathom a scenario where he could be in any real danger. He sees  the presence of the characters as an opportunity  to get to the bottom of what's happening in Wickermoor Hollow while also helping the citizens he's neglected for so long.

entries.name: Friendly
entries: Phillip enjoys the company of those who appreciate his wit and the finer things in life. He is particularly drawn to individuals who intrigue him.

entries.name: Indifferent
entries: Phillip treats most people as amusing diversions, neither valuing nor dismissing them until they prove their worth.

entries.name: Hostile
entries: Phillip rarely loses his composure, but those who attempt to control him, obstruct his inquiries, or disrespect his wife Adela earn his contempt, a slight from which few ever recover.

monsterFluff.name: Adela Druskenvald
entries: Adela Druskenvald is the loving partner-in-crime of her husband Phillip. She rules Druskenvald alongside him, and while she similarly has a distaste for politics and bureaucracy, she often serves as a voice of reason and a reminder of the responsibility to help the people across the thirteen provinces.

While Phillip is an otherworldly entity from regions unknown, Adela was born a mortal woman and lived in the material world for the first three decades of her life. As a child, her paranormal experiences and prophetic visions led to her discovery of immense powers of divination and a strong connection to the spiritual world.

As a young woman, Adela's curiosity and dauntlessness brought her face-to-face with Phillip aboard the Ghostlight Express, and the two fell in love at first sight. They were quickly married, and as a Druskenvald, Adela became immortal, enjoying her endless youth by seeking every new and exciting experience she could find.

While Adela has an exceptional gift of second sight, she doubts her own abilities, which often leads to her misinterpreting her visions. Despite this anxiety and her cheerful, almost ditzy demeanor, there is reason to believe that she is far more crafty, calculating, and deliberate than she lets on.

Even with her gift of prophecy, she is powerless to stop her fate as a sacrificial lamb in the ritual to free the Crooked Queen. Throughout the adventure, her visions become increasingly grave but also more difficult to interpret.

entries.name: Friendly
entries: Adela adores those who embrace adventure, indulge in lively conversation, or humor her prophetic musings.
She enjoys the company of those who appreciate the finer things in life and challenge her perceptions.

entries.name: Indifferent
entries: Adela treats most strangers with polite curiosity, but unless they pique her interest, she remains preoccupied with her visions and pleasures, flitting from one obsession to the next without much concern.

entries.name: Hostile
entries: Adela rarely shows malice, but those who betray her trust or threaten Phillip incite an icy fury-one hidden behind a sweet smile and a seemingly careless laugh.

monsterFluff.name: Adelaide Langtree
entries: Adelaide is the eldest child of {@creature Martha Langtree|CrookedMoon24|Martha} at twenty-five years old. She was a difficult child who played over-competitively with the other children and enjoyed morbid practical jokes to peeve her unpleasant father, like hiding rat carcasses in his boots overnight. Jericho was her best friend because she had a hard time making friends with other kids her age.

As she grew older, Adelaide's antisocial behavior deepened. Jericho vanished on her twenty-fifth birthday, and ever since, she's wandered into the cornfields after her nightly work, only returning when it's time for bed. Some whisper she killed Jericho, while others claim she's searching for her only friend. None who followed her into the corn have ever returned.

Three weeks after Jericho's disappearance, she found him—now the monstrous, crow-headed demon, Raum. {@creature The Harvest Terror|CrookedMoon24} spoke with Jericho's voice, calling himself her best friend, vowing to love her if she revealed her secrets. She confessed witnessing her father's abuse and her mother's fatal act.

The demon Raum told her that he is an angel sent to reveal the evil secrets in Foxwillow. Confused, but seduced by his words, Adelaide has spent recent months gathering secrets and luring folks into the cornfields, where Raum spirits them away to wander forever in the Fields of the Crow.

entries.name: Changing Adelaide's Attitude
entries: Adelaide is fully in Raum's thrall. She can't be swayed from being {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward the characters.

entries.name: Adelaide's Secret
entries: In her communion with Raum, Adelaide has learned {@creature William Lodge|CrookedMoon24|William's} secret—that her brother Isaac is really her half-brother. She's been manipulated into believing that her mother's infidelity and her half-brother's birth are the real causes of her fear and suffering in childhood. She was goaded by Raum into murdering Isaac, and she hid his corpse in the basement of the Old Windmill (area J1), where it is incubating a demonic servant of the Harvest Terror.

entries.name: Learning Her Secret
entries: Adelaide's murderous secret is revealed when the characters find her brother's corpse in the Windmill Cellar (area J9b). If her mother Martha is told of what happened, Martha weeps and gives the characters a handmade brass locket her brother made for her to try and earn her love as a child.

monsterFluff.name: Alda Farnum
entries: Alda owns and manages the Green Queen Inn. She comes off as friendly, but everything is a transaction to her, whether the currency is coins, gems, art, skills, or favors. Even the most inattentive person doesn't need much time around Alda to see through her polite faade. Her brown hair is worn up under a hat, and her perfectly tailored outfits exude an air of quiet authority.

As a young woman, Alda became disenfranchised with the Old Ways, favoring the prosperity and comfort that modernity provides. However, when she happened upon an ancient tome filled with primeval rituals that harness Kehlenn's essence, she quickly discovered that she could use such power to grow her wealth and station in life. She has since joined the cult of the Crooked Queen as a means to an end in her constant quest for riches and authority.

monsterFluff.name: Baltus Tolliver
entries: Baltus Tolliver left Wickermoor Village and traveled across Druskenvald as a young man. He returned a decade later with some wealth, a whole lot of lavish goods, and the contacts to find any strange oddity across the domain. Using a blend of charm and intimidation, Baltus established the largest trading post in the hollow. He sells everything from basic goods to rare trinkets.

He is a slender man who wears the same gray suit every night, making sure it is meticulously cleaned every evening. He's clean-shaven, and his thinning black hair betrays his upper middle age. He wears plain silver rings and smokes a decoratively carved mahogany pipe.

Although he spent his youth away from Wickermoor Hollow, Baltus is a Follower of the Old Ways that serves in the cult of the Crooked Queen. He was called home by the ever-growing strength of Kehlenn, and his wealth and trading power help fund and coordinate efforts to unleash her. His guards revere the Old Ways and the Green Queen, but they are unaware of Baltus's allegiance to the wicked cult.

monsterFluff.name: Beatrice Wells
entries: Beatrice Wells is a master carpenter and invaluable asset to Wickermoor Village. From wagons to furniture to structures, Beatrice is an expert with wood, known equally for her artistry and the sturdiness of her creations. She has a visionary quality that allows for unique and breathtaking work. She is fascinated beyond reason by the twisted architecture of the Crooked House (see chapter 12).

Beatrice, along with her husband Branden (Chaotic Good, human {@creature Commoner|XMM}) and their four young children, Robin, Lark, Jay, and Wren (Neutral Good, human noncombatant {@creature Commoner|XMM|Commoners}), live in their second-floor living quarters.

The Wells family dutifully follow the teachings of the Brightsinger (see chapter 8). As she finds free time, Beatrice started building a chapel for {@creature Weston Murdoch|CrookedMoon24} on the Abandoned Church site (area V19). The Wells family dresses in bright clothes and sing songs to each other, even as they work.

monsterFluff.name: Dani Jenkin
entries: Dani was born to {@creature Walter Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Walter} and {@creature Gilly Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Gilly} within a couple of weeks of their move to the mayoral manor to serve {@creature Wendel Somerton|CrookedMoon24|Mayor Somerton's} family. Now ten years old, she senses the ghosts and disturbing forces around her, knowing things a child shouldn't. Though she cannot yet control her abilities, her bond with the powers of the Old Ways grows.

monsterFluff.name: Shuck
entries: A red-furred dog that never leaves {@creature Dani Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Dani's} side, Shuck was a stray before the Jenkins took him in. Unbeknownst to the family, Shuck is the reincarnated soul of Sally Lockwood, a victim of the Crooked House who escaped just before her death. Shuck guards Dani fiercely. If any of the characters are evil, or if they use supernatural abilities that are in any way associated with the Crooked Queen, Shuck growls at them if they get anywhere near Dani.

monsterFluff.name: Wisp
entries: The estate's gray cat has earned {@creature Walter Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Walter's} affection but terrifies {@creature Dani Jenkin|CrookedMoon24|Dani}. The cat is no ordinary feline; it is a shapeshifted {@creature Ketgrinn|CrookedMoon24}, a Fey in service to {@creature Vessla Browntooth|CrookedMoon24}. Wisp stole Walter's voice and torments Dani by speaking to her when they are alone. {@creature Shuck|CrookedMoon24} loathes Wisp, sensing his true nature, and stays close to protect Dani from the lurking evil. If the ketgrinn's true form is exposed and slain, Walter's ability to speak is restored.

monsterFluff.name: Doctor Belkin
